intro_text: r_c tastes the air and perks up - there's a lanternmouse nearby, nibbling on some nuts near the base of a tree!
decline_text: After a moment's deliberation, r_c decides to move on.

success_outcomes.text: The wind suddenly shifts, and the lanternmouse jerks its head up in alarm. r_c thinks fast, bolting to cut off its escape before delivering the killing blow.
Though it tries to escape, r_c is faster and smarter - they slam a paw down on the lanternmouse's tail before it can go very far, and kill it with ease.
r_c silently slinks through the underbrush, going undetected until they've pounced - and by then it's far too late for the lanternmouse to do anything about it.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c breaks a twig as they ready themself to pounce, and the resulting crack alerts the lanternmouse. It doesn't even spare them a glance as it scurries up the tree and out of sight.

intro_text: app1 scents a lanternmouse on the air! The dried leaves on the ground make them a little nervous, and they wonder if they can navigate quietly enough to catch it...
decline_text: They decide to move on and ignore the lanternmouse for now.

success_outcomes.text: app1 slides into a hunting pose, trying not to focus too hard on making it perfect. They're right not to - their catch is flawless, and they return home with their chest puffed out in pride.
Though they're a little sloppy, and the lanternmouse quickly spots them, app1 manages to secure the catch in the end!

fail_outcomes.text: Poor app1 focuses too hard on making sure their hunting crouch is correct - by the time they feel ready, the lanternmouse is long gone.

intro_text: p_l instructs app1 to scent the air, and nods in approval when app1 says they smell lanternmouse. Leaf-fall makes hunting a little trickier, and p_l gently prompts app1 to see if they remember how to navigate the leaf-litter.
decline_text: app1 looks apprehensive, and quietly says they want to look for something easier.

success_outcomes.text: app1 slides into a hunting pose, trying not to focus too hard on making it perfect. They're right not to - their catch is flawless, and they puff their chest out in pride as p_l praises them.
Though they're a little sloppy, and the lanternmouse quickly spots them, app1 manages to secure the catch in the end! p_l looks pleased, and gives them tips to improve their technique next time.

fail_outcomes.text: A too-high tail brushing against the bushes is all that's needed to scare the lanternmouse away, and app1 watches in disappointment as it scampers away.

intro_text: As the patrol walks through the forest, a loud chittering from above interrupts them. One slugcat looks up just in time to get a shower of twigs and dead leaves to the face, while another exclaims aloud as they spot lanternmice darting through the branches above.
decline_text: Though they snort in amusement, the patrol decides to move on to easier prey, rather than waste their energy amongst the trees.

success_outcomes.text: Before anyone can even speak, there's a loud crack from above. The slugcats scatter as a branch crashes down, bringing both lanternmice and a shower of oak leaves with it! The patrol thinks fast, and pounce on the lanternmice before they can escape. They head home with their bounty, each scug feeling quite pleased with themself.

A mischievous look in their eye, the deputy challenges their Clanmates - whoever catches one of the lanternmice gets to skip dawn patrol for a whole cycle. They're all eager to shimmy up the trees at that, and before long someone calls out in triumph. Not only do they have the lanternmouse, but they also have a pawful of oak leaves for the cleric as well!

With a glint in their eye, s_c is up in the trees before anyone can say anything. There's rustling, a short pause, then lanternmouse carcasses begin falling to the ground, one by one. s_c descends when they've finished with a mouthful of oak leaves, curling their tail in pride at the looks on their Clanmates faces.

fail_outcomes.text: Though they try to climb the trees in pursuit, the lanternmice are much more suited to running along the branches, and they easily leave the patrol floundering as they disappear into the distance.

The patrol fans out, some slugcats climbing, some staying on the ground. The hunt comes to an abrupt end, however, when r_c yowls in fear as they plummet from the branches and land heavily on the ground. Their Clanmates help them home and settle them into the cleric's den, guilt and regret prickling at them for pursuing such a foolhardy hunt.

intro_text: As the patrol crunches through the dead leaves littering the woods, r_c explains an idea they had for lanternmouse hunting. It sounds a little strange, but perhaps it could work?
decline_text: The patrol decides they'd rather not spend time on something that might not work when they could be doing something they know does.

success_outcomes.text: r_c suggests baiting the lanternmice with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. It's pretty tedious, and they end up having to move a few times, but it does work, and the patrol heads home with a decent amount of prey.

r_c suggests baiting the lanternmice with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. Waiting is the most difficult part; the lanternmice don't seem to expect the trap, and they come home laden with prey.

r_c suggests baiting the lanternmice with food and picking them off when they come out to eat. All the patrol has to do is set the trap - with s_c on the patrol, they rarely have to lift a paw, and each slugcat carries multiple lanternmice home.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c suggests finding lanternmice sheltered in trees, climbing above them, and shaking the branches to scare them down. Unfortunately for them, the idea is a little too far out there, and while they do manage a few small catches, the day is mostly wasted with little to show for it.

intro_text: The rain seems a constant, unceasing beat, punctuating the steps of the hunting patrol as they march towards their hunting ground. But there's one less set of footsteps than there should be. p_l can't see r_c in the watery haze.
decline_text: r_c eventually catches up.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol backtracks. r_c is found, huddled under a bush - they lost the path, and sight of their Clanmates, but sensibly remained put. It's one more obstacle in a miserable day of hunting. They return with prey, but it's exhausting and barely worth the effort.

p_l nearly jumps out of their pelt when r_c materializes next to them. Where in the Void have they been?! But no, r_c has found a copse of trees so thick and overgrowth that they're merely damp, not soaked. It's better than p_l could have hoped for, and the hunting patrol can return to camp with a decent haul.

p_l, leading the search for s_c, hears a yowl in the distance. They charge towards the sound, swerving around trees, spotting s_c at the base of a hazel tree. They're staring up, tail lashing intently. On a branch above the slugcats, an adult noodlefly sits with drooping, waterlogged wings. Oh. Yes, that'll do nicely.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l is silently furious at r_c when they find them. Leaf-fall is not the time to waste what could have been a productive hunting patrol with whatever nonsense r_c was up to.
r_c is discovered huddled under a bush, soaked to the skin and dangerously cold.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred after disappearing on patrol and being discovered injured.

intro_text: p_l travels through the blustery wind to hunt. In a pile of leaves, they swear they could see a spider's leg.
decline_text: It could be a single spider.. or it could be a swarm of them lying in wait. Either way, it's too risky for p_l to pursue.

success_outcomes.text: p_l lunges for the spider's leg with their claws and catches the spider! They drag it back to camp with their head held high.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l lunges for the spider's leg, but it turns out to be a wriggling worm! Gross!

intro_text: p_l traverses the windy forest, trying their best to focus and not get distracted by the dancing leaves when they catch the scent of a spider nearby.
decline_text: p_l decides that one spider isn't worth missing out on some fun! They instead chase after leaves for the rest of the hunting patrol.

success_outcomes.text: p_l sees the spider's leg in a clump of leaves and pounced after it. Their head is held high as they travel back to camp with the large piece of fresh-kill!

fail_outcomes.text: p_l's eyes flicker back towards the leaves, and can't help but swipe at them as they flutter by. When their attention returns to the spider, it's long gone.

intro_text: p_l and app1 make their way towards a troop of mushrooms, eager to get more prey for the Clan. They hear spiders chittering amongst the fungi, and begin to plot their plan of attack.
decline_text: p_l eventually decides to lead their patrol elsewhere. Who knows what dangerous effect those mushrooms could have on them.

success_outcomes.text: p_l and app1 crouch and stalk slowly towards the mushrooms, pouncing carefully in between the fungi and onto the spiders! Spores coating their fur the two make their way back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 attempts to pounce onto the spiders, but crashes headfirst into a spore puff! The spiders scatter, and p_l leads a sneezing app1 back to camp.

intro_text: p_l leads the patrol towards the abandoned scavenger nest, listening to r_c's plan. Spiders were seen hiding inside to protect themselves from the chill of leaf-fall's winds. Perhaps it would be a perfect hunting spot?
decline_text: The other slugcats disagree with such a risk, and resume their normal hunting patrol.

success_outcomes.text: r_c leads the patrol towards the nest, pushing past the rotting wood blocking the entrance. The patrol gets to work rounding up and piling up the spiders, and by nightfall they have so much it takes two trips to bring them back! r_c is congratulated for their ingenious plan.

r_c leads the patrol towards the nest, and they quickly get to work hunting down the spiders cornered near the smooth stones. It's a tough fight, with spiders attempting to flee or attack the patrol, but in the end the patrol manages to get a hefty pile of prey for c_n.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c leads the slugcats to the abandoned scavenger nest, but as the scugs search and search, all they can find are abandoned spider webs. r_c is scolded for wasting the patrol's valuable time.
r_c leads the slugcats to the abandoned scavenger nest, but the spiders seemed to be livelier than they thought. A harsh battle forces the patrol to retreat, r_c being the most harshly wounded.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting a swarm of spiders.

intro_text: A legend has been sighted. Recently, warriors have reported sighting a mother spider, larger and more dangerous than anything the Clan has seen. Will p_l's patrol look for this legendary monster?
decline_text: No. Such a thing can't exist, right? It has to be an elder's imagination. p_l decides to take {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol elsewhere to hunt.

success_outcomes.text: The mother spider's lair is heavily defended by smaller spiders. While the patrol doesn't find any sign of the rat king, they manage to defeat and bring back a feast of small spiders.

The spiders defending the mother spider's lair are more numerous than they thought. The patrol catches whatever spiders they can, but p_l swears that {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} saw it - multiple eyes glowing in the dark, watching them.

The waves of spiders overwhelm the rest of the patrol, but s_c can see the mother spider writhing within its nest. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/bolt/bolts} away from the others, trusting {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} claws to take on the legend. It dies with a horrible shriek, as the rest of the patrol watch in awe.

fail_outcomes.text: There are more spiders defending the mother spider's lair than they thought. Fighting off waves of them, the patrol retreats back to the Clan with empty paws.
The mother spider and their minions overwhelm the patrol, biting into fur and limbs. p_l orders a retreat, and {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/hope/hopes} the Clan can heal so many wounded.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting a mother spider.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after battling a mother spider.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c knows {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} one of the Clan's greatest hunters. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/spot/spots} the mother spider and charge into its lair. But the spider proves too great a foe for a single scug, and it sends s_c back with wounds to tell {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tale.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting a mother spider.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after battling a mother spider.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after battling a mother spider.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c knows {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is} one of the Clan's greatest hunters. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/spot/spots} the mother spider and {VERB/s_c/charge/charges} into its lair. But the spider proves too great a foe for a single scug, and it kills the would-be slayer.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after battling a mother spider.

intro_text: Something skitters across the leaf litter, catching the patrol's eyes. A hatchling lizard!
decline_text: Startled by the lizard, the patrol watches it scurry away.

success_outcomes.text: r_c pounces on the little creature! The nice mouthful is a great start to what turns into a decent hunting patrol, the orange leaves drifting around the patrol in clouds of color.

The lizard drops the batfly it held, and r_c dives for it, while p_l pounces for the lizard. Surely this counts for two catches? Neither of them cares much, and it's a happy afternoon hunting together.

s_c is basically on top of the skittering lizard, and ends up doing a ridiculous hop to come down on it with claws extended. r_c compliments them on the catch with a laugh in their meow, and s_c has to agree with them, purring with amusement.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol is unable to catch the small reptile quick enough and the little lizard lives another day.
r_c and p_l go for the prey at the same time, bonking their heads together. Not a bad collision, and both of them are mature enough to let it go, but neither is pleased to have missed an easy catch.

intro_text: Something skitters across the leaf litter, catching the patrol's eyes. A hatchling lizard!
decline_text: Startled by the lizard, the patrol watches it scurry away.

success_outcomes.text: app1 pounces on the little creature and misses, but they don't seem overly concerned, stopping nearly every step to chat to app2, who's just as keen to talk.

app1 and app2 go for the prey at the same time, bonking their heads together. It makes both of them laugh while apologizing, and they don't leave each other's side for the rest of the patrol, apologies turning to chatting turning to whispered conversations.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol is unable to catch the small reptile quick enough and the little lizard lives another day.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a lizard - but is it white, or blue? Tracking it, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} their white enemy feeding on a rain deer fawn carcass. It's impossible to say whether the lizard killed it or found it.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to quarrel with the lizard and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: Your cats are smaller, but they outnumber the lizard, if only by a little, and it's a prize they're willing to fight for. With a prayer to the Ascended they throw themselves into battle, and the lizard, already half full of venison and unwilling to lose blood over it, is driven off from the kill.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the lizard. By working together and keeping it distracted, the slugcats harry and harass the lizard until it gives up and runs.

The patrol launches into battle, but with so few slugcats it's exhausting trying to keep the lizard and its snapping jaws on the defensive. In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under its snout, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the lizard's throat. It's only one bite, but the lizard has had enough and flees.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol fails to drive away the lizard, which keeps possession of the food. However, there were no injuries.
The patrol launches into battle, but r_c is caught with a nasty bite, and the slugcats give up on challenging for the food in favor of quickly helping r_c back to the cleric den.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lizard fight.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c means well, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} overconfident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} attack and the lizard manages to sink their teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the wounded s_c.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lizard fight.

The lizard runs, but there's no way it'll live long with such a debilitating injury.

The patrol launches into battle, keeping the lizard on the defensive with teamwork. In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under its snout, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the lizard's throat. s_c holds on grimly as the rest of the patrol takes the opportunity to bring the lizard down for good.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol fails to drive away the lizard, which keeps possession of the food. However, with so many slugcats to protect each other, there were no injuries.

s_c uses every trick in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} talented fighting skillset to attack the lizard with no one to watch {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} flank, until the perfect opportunity opens up and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pounce/pounces} onto the lizard's back, digging in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} claws. decline_text: They decide to bask for a bit instead of making the long walk.

success_outcomes.text: Together, they collect an old f_mp_s and two f_mp_p. It should be a great patrol, returning with so much prey - but r_c is acting obnoxious and {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} siblings have little time or patience for it.
r_c makes a dumb comment that accidentally cuts deep. {PRONOUN/r_c/poss/CAP} siblings work with {PRONOUN/r_c/object} long enough to bring back a good haul of prey - but no longer.

fail_outcomes.text: Today is just not their day.
The patrol tries to hunt, but r_c keeps stopping to duck behind bushes, until it's obvious that something is actually wrong. Eww.

intro_text: p_l finds a patch of herbs that {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} believe c_n might need for their stores. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} freely admit to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/aren't/isn't} a cleric, and ask {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} companions' advice. What do they know about this part of the forest's herbal properties, especially in the harvest season of leaf-fall?
decline_text: They decide to focus on hunting and leave the herb collecting to the clerics.

success_outcomes.text: It's not their normal task, but they're all smart enough to value supporting the Clan's cleric. The patrol brings the herbs back to camp and they are put to good use.

s_c carefully plucks some of the herbs and takes them back to the camp to be identified before the patrol goes to the trouble of collecting them, smartly deciding to get an informed opinion before committing the patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol brings the herbs back to camp, only to find out that while the herbs promote good gut health, they're not a rare resource. Still, c_n will be eating an extra healthy dinner tonight with the herbs sprinkled into their freshkill.
